intro: Wendlandia scabra var. scabra, commonly known as the rough-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, rough-textured leaves and bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its flowers are usually blue or violet in color and bloom during the warmer months. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in a variety of garden settings.
